chapter.title: Review of two guiding questions
chapter.content:
Review of two guiding questions

We’ll finish up this course by reviewing our two guiding questions.

Our two guiding questions were:

  • What does it mean for an adult with LD to be self-determined?
  • What can adult service providers do to promote self-determination for adults with LD?

chapter.title: Review of guiding question #1
chapter.content:
Review of guiding question #1

In exploring guiding question number one, we began by asking you about a time in your life when self-determination played a role. We then discussed importance of self-determination for a person with LD, and examined six factors that affect an individual’s ability to be self-determined.

chapter.title: Review of guiding question #2
chapter.content:
Review of guiding question #2

In response to our second guiding question, we gathered ideas for adult service providers wishing to promote self-determination for adults with LD. We then asked you to prioritize at least two of the six factors for your learners, and to make a plan to implement at least one idea or strategy to address those factors in your adult education practice.

We hope you will be able to use this information to enable individuals with LD to:

  • overcome challenges they face and assume greater control over their lives;
  • achieve their educational goals; and
  • improve their confidence in themselves and their abilities.

chapter.title: Participate in the forum discussions
chapter.content:
Participate in the forum discussions

Congratulations on completing Learning to Achieve’s Self-Determination course! We encourage you to stay involved in the LINCS Community and the LINCS Disabilities in Adult Education Group as you strive to incorporate strategies for helping adults with LD to develop self-determination. We encourage you to discuss and apply your newly acquired knowledge and learn about others' experiences in teaching and supporting adults with LD.
